tags: you can't tell me other wise
bran stark is a good boy clown club
summary:
Some headcanons for Bran-Stark-Is-A-Good-Boy Clown Club to fill the void.
King Bran & co.  Ep.1
Bran gradually regained his...
body:
Some headcanons for Bran-Stark-Is-A-Good-Boy Clown Club to fill the void.

King Bran & co. Ep.1

  • Bran gradually regained his humanity during the first two years of his reign thanks to endless works of rebuilding a city, and the daily “outburst” of his small council. He passed out the moment his head hit the surface of the pillows every night, he barely had time to linger and brood in the past. Even warging became a luxury.
  • He is surprisingly good with kids. Children of the royal staffs, servants, and noble lords love following around his wheelchair when he isn’t wearing a crown and looks less kingly and menacing. He’s a patient listener, he has tons of stories to tell. ( Despite his habitual monotone and deadpan, Tyrion can tell that Bran enjoys the company of children more than adults.)
  • Bronn tried to get back at Bran for constantly embarrassing him in front of his small council. He inebriated the boy once during a small party (and had to live with Brienne’s death glare for the rest of that week) and somehow got Bran to sing. Turned out the king got a decent voice. And he knows some pretty indecent songs as well. (Bronn was impressed.) That part remained a secret among his court.
  • Everytime Bran zones out during council meetings they all thought their king was scouting with ravens or doing investigation of some sort, while most of the time he’s just chiming with a flock of warblers in the garden. He secretly enjoys this. Whenever Sansa feels lonely and misses her family, she could always found a songbird singing outside her window. She knows that’s her brother and she’s glad that he has developed a new (and comparatively healthy) hobby.
  • Brienne finally learnt about Meera and her past history with Bran. And she actually made Bran sit in front of his desk for a whole afternoon and wrote that girl an apology letter of 1000 words because Boy I don’t care if you’re the king that’s not how you treat a lady friend who had been through life and death with you. That’s not how you treat a woman who cares about you. Basically Brienne becomes the biggest Breera shipper, and supervising on the king to make sure he properly court lady Reed kind of helped her deal with her own wounds.

Ep.2 featuring more of ser Mom and my new favorite brOTP3 (bran, podrick, gendry) coming soon.

tags: the 7k probably going to go to shit real fast
summary: Some unanswered GoT questions that no one seems to be asking
body:
Some unanswered GoT questions that no one seems to be asking

Why did Dany completely forget about the Sand Snakes? I mean, a passing comment about the demise of these badass women (and their armies) pledged to her might have been nice.

Why wasn’t YARA the one to kill Euron? I mean that was her family grudge and revenge, was it not?

Why did no one in eight seasons of this show notice what a goddamn SNACK Jorah Mormont was? I know in the books he was ugly and gross, but Show!Jorah was simply divine. This was a guy who deserved a girlfriend, a wife, a nice life. I’m sad that he never got any of those things.

How did everyone traveling with Dany instantly know of her and Jon’s relationship? How loud were they on that damn boat? POOR SER JORAH. Can you imagine?

How is Daario faring in Mereen now that Dany’s dead? Would have been nice if he and his cute butt got a shout-out.

Seriously how pissed is everyone going to be when they find out that Bran’s more or less immortal and Tyrion knew the whole time?

How is Sansa going to feed everyone in the North now that she has cut them off from the assistance of the 6K? Wasn’t she worried about that at the start of the season?

How is Bran going to defend his empire when the Iron Islands and Dorne inevitably rebel? Does he even have an army?

When do the peasants of KL begin their uprising? Their city is destroyed, the commander of the army who invaded them killed their leader, now his brother is on the throne and is being advised by the person they know as a monster who fled from justice. I mean, that’s definitely enough for a rebellion, don’t you think?

And why hasn’t anyone acknowledged that the true winner of the Game of Thrones is Nymeria, who has the blessing of living away from human civilization?

tags: also I'm really side-eying tumblr for what they're doing to block quotes
summary: Have you any thoughts on jon and brans relationship it was always my fave stark bond but i am a little worried that it will go...
question: Have you any thoughts on jon and brans relationship it was always my fave stark bond but i am a little worried that it will go under in all the stark meetings to come
answer:
Jon and Bran have such a sweet, underrated relationship, one that gets overlooked a lot in light of other ones but that I think is vitally important all the same. Jon’s goodbye to an unconscious Bran before he leaves for the Wall, as well as their currently close geographical proximity to one another, suggest to me that their reunion will be significant, beyond “my brother who I thought was dead is really alive.”

There’s a lot in the text that makes me think that Jon and Bran hold importance to one another in terms of characters (naturally: they’re siblings, they each admire things about the other, they both miss one another, etc), but also a great deal that hints at their importance to each other in terms of plot. Of all the Starklings, Jon and Bran are the only two directly involved in the conflict with the White Walkers. Not to mention that, post-resurrection, Jon will also be far more familiar with warging. 

GRRM makes sure to drop symbols and hints (sometimes not even subtle ones) in Jon’s chapters about his brother. Bran has tried to talk to him through dreams, trees, and possibly even birds:

He rose and dressed in darkness, as Mormont’s raven muttered across the room. “Corn,” the bird said, and, “King,” and, “Snow, Jon Snow, Jon Snow.” That was queer. The bird had never said his full name before, as best Jon could recall. (Jon XII, ADWD)

Bran is intricately connected to the fight against the Others, just as Jon is; of the main six characters, they’re the only two who have inside information regarding the true enemy, and the only two that have been close enough to cross paths in their respective journeys. Beyond their emotional significance to one another, I tend to think that their future reunion will provide a vital shift in the overall story’s plot as well.

reblog.comment:
Jon and Bran have such a sweet, underrated relationship, one that gets overlooked a lot in light of other ones but that I think is vitally important all the same. Jon’s goodbye to an unconscious Bran before he leaves for the Wall, as well as their currently close geographical proximity to one another, suggest to me that their reunion will be significant, beyond “my brother who I thought was dead is really alive.”

There’s a lot in the text that makes me think that Jon and Bran hold importance to one another in terms of characters (naturally: they’re siblings, they each admire things about the other, they both miss one another, etc), but also a great deal that hints at their importance to each other in terms of plot. Of all the Starklings, Jon and Bran are the only two directly involved in the conflict with the White Walkers. Not to mention that, post-resurrection, Jon will also be far more familiar with warging. 

GRRM makes sure to drop symbols and hints (sometimes not even subtle ones) in Jon’s chapters about his brother. Bran has tried to talk to him through dreams, trees, and possibly even birds:

He rose and dressed in darkness, as Mormont’s raven muttered across the room. “Corn,” the bird said, and, “King,” and, “Snow, Jon Snow, Jon Snow.” That was queer. The bird had never said his full name before, as best Jon could recall. (Jon XII, ADWD)

Bran is intricately connected to the fight against the Others, just as Jon is; of the main six characters, they’re the only two who have inside information regarding the true enemy, and the only two that have been close enough to cross paths in their respective journeys. Beyond their emotional significance to one another, I tend to think that their future reunion will provide a vital shift in the overall story’s plot as well.

trail.content_raw:
Jon and Bran have such a sweet, underrated relationship, one that gets overlooked a lot in light of other ones but that I think is vitally important all the same. Jon’s goodbye to an unconscious Bran before he leaves for the Wall, as well as their currently close geographical proximity to one another, suggest to me that their reunion will be significant, beyond “my brother who I thought was dead is really alive.”

Bran is intricately connected to the fight against the Others, just as Jon is; of the main six characters, they’re the only two who have inside information regarding the true enemy, and the only two that have been close enough to cross paths in their respective journeys. Beyond their emotional significance to one another, I tend to think that their future reunion will provide a vital shift in the overall story’s plot as well.

summary: “He looked at the words, but they didn’t matter. Nothing mattered. Bran was going to live. “My brother is going to live,” he...
body:
“He looked at the words, but they didn’t matter. Nothing mattered. Bran was going to live. “My brother is going to live,” he told Mormont. The Lord Commander shook his head, gathered up a fistful of corn, and whistled. The raven flew to his shoulder, crying, “Live! Live!”
Jon ran down the stairs, a smile on his face and Robb’s letter in his hand. “My brother is going to live,” he told the guards. They exchanged a look. He ran back to the common hall, where he found Tyrion Lannister just finishing his meal. He grabbed the little man under the arms, hoisted him up in the air, and spun him around in a circle. “Bran is going to live!” he whooped.”

Jon being all happy and excited, telling everyone and their mothers the happy news, picking Tyrion up and making him dance, acting silly like the 15yearsold boy he is supposed to be
